lines.text: I do not understand the human race/Has so little love for creatures with a different face./Treating animals like people is no madness or disgrace./I do not understand the human race.
I speak over two thousand languages, including Dodo and Unicorn.
Unicorn?
I had a classical education.
I promise to ask for no special privileges.
I promise to grant none
If I were his nephew instead of his niece...
If you were his nephew, you'd hardly be called Emma Fairfax.

[consulting a medical book]
This fellow obviously knows what he's talking about.
Who wrote the book, Doctor?

[suddenly realizing]
Er... oh, *I* did.
Oh it's from Long Arrow.
Who's he when he's at home?
An old friend of mine. He's a Red Indian gentleman.
With a name like "Long Arrow" I didn't think he'd be Irish.
I told you 'Flounder' was a terrible name for a boat!

[talking about learning goldfish]
Most fish languages are a combination of bubbles and mouth movement. At the moment, all I can make is large bubbles and they keep telling me I'm shouting.
General Bellowes...
He certainly does.
General Bellowes is my uncle.
I'm sorry.
Is that an apology?
I'm sorry he's your uncle.
What are you trying to say?
What?
I mean, why don't you say what you mean?
What do you mean, say what I mean?

[singing]
For a month or more/I have listened and dreamed/While the moon has glistened and a million stars have gleamed/Waiting/
Waiting?
Waiting/
What for?

What for!/For a man I know who is clever and kind/But a man who never, ever seems to know his mind/Waiting/Waiting/Waiting for you to say you like me/Or hate me/Or miss me/Or kiss me/Or something/But nothing!/Nothing do you say at all!/Little wonder I feel sorely/Neglected/Unwanted/Rejected/And small/Little more than two feet tall!
Well, it's true/We do not live in a zoo/But Man is an animal too./So why can't you, like me/Like animals?

[Rufus the dog has just testified to General Bellowes' having had six helping of blackberry pie at dinner]
It's not true! I only had *five* helpings of blackberry pie!

[after the shipwreck when they are locked up on the floating island]
You know, bein' is prison is much the same as being on a boat. Except in prison there's less chance of drowning.

[after breaking the Doctor out of prison and escaping by ship]
If you ask me, bein' at sea is very much the same as bein' in prison, except at sea ya stand a better chance of drownin'.
Hello... Me Doctor Dolittle. Here little boy, late for school, here very cold. They all go home "Puddleby," yes?

[in perfect English]
What a funny accent.
If one place is as good as any other, it's high time we decided. Otherwise when we get there, we won't know we've arrived.
Tell me, Stubbins... what would you do if you had two heads?
I'd join a circus, sir!
Exactly.

[singing about why he's a vegetarian]
I stay away from deviled ham on principle/I wouldn't eat roast duckling if I could/Willpower has made me invincible!/My word, those sausages look good...
